Comment: Well, the P is for ....  But I suppose it is where we are talking about.  Old school preppy New England WASPs were more or less Anglican, Episcopalian, or some other derivative of the Church of England.  The only other group of people that I am aware of who referred to themselves as WASPs were more or less upper-middle class, white, Conservatives, as the name denotes a bit of money and social influence.  Protestants are those who broke away from the Catholic Church back in the day, including the Church of England.  But, although the Church of England broke from the Catholic Church it still retained a good chunk of stuff from Catholicism, so a little of both.    However, these days the term seems to be applied to anyone who is white and not a liberal.
